We are a fast-growing data consulting and support services firm - focused on large data programs in data types such as geospatial, open, big, and IoT data. Check out www.xentity.com to learn about our focus, services, clients, missions, values as well as our excellent benefits package and career information.
We have high profile clients and projects that our staff really delivery for, as well enjoy knowing they make a large difference.
Our President has a vision to continue to focus on solutions that transform the Next Generation. Using data integration, knowledge solutions, and amazing increases in computing to impact energy, geosciences, land management, we can bring quality and simplifications to existing and new data flow! Imaging being on a team that brings advanced concepts like high performance computing, AI, data science, fuzzy logic, changing interfaces human-computer points mobile or augmented reality and many more disruptions. This truly can put the I back in IT and GIS.... by concentrating on pragmatic knowledge-first data designs, leadership and management, and the all too forgotten focus on outreach and engagement strategies and solutions.

Frontier Airlines is committed to offering ‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 80 destinations in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 300 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Rocky Mountain hospitality to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2016 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies.
The Senior Analyst, Revenue Analytics develops analytical tools and statistical models to maximize Frontier’s revenue generation and profitability. The Analyst will be responsible for building data pipelines & coding automated reporting processes, creating data visualizations and dashboards, identifying and quantifying revenue opportunities, and crafting clear presentations to management. As an integral part of Frontier's success, Revenue Analytics Analysts receive high visibility by senior management and enjoy a range of formal training and informal learning opportunities to support ongoing professional development and career growth.
Essential Functions:
Identify & quantify revenue opportunities across the organization
Work with the Pricing and Revenue Management teams to identify new opportunities for generating revenue
Build statistical models and present findings to relevant stakeholders
Create visualizations and dashboards to illustrate key trends and KPIs
Work with a wide variety of teams with diverse technical backgrounds
Enhance the Revenue Analytics infrastructure by implementing best practice coding & structure
Create data pipelines to transform raw input into clean datasets for use in analysis
Write clean, efficient code to automate processes
Mentor more junior team members, and foster the development of their programming and analytics skills
Collaborate with diverse teams across the company
Conduct ad-hoc projects, reports and analyses as determined by management
Set the standard for the broader team in thought processes and analytical output
Achieve expert status in business and industry trends
Clearly communicate the actionable business implications of complex quantitative analyses to senior management
Lead change across the organization by improving directly owned processes and taking initiative to champion cross-functional opportunities
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree required; major(s) in Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Aviation Management or related analytical field strongly preferred; combination of education and work experience considered in lieu of degree
Advanced degree in one of above disciplines preferred
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, revenue management, operations research, finance, or a similar analytical field (Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline will be considered with reduced years of experience)
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong programming skills, with knowledge of Python strongly preferred
Ability to write complex SQL code to query against disparate data sources
Strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with Power BI or Tableau
Solid grasp of statistics or machine learning preferred
Strong organizational skills and the ability to keep track of several projects at once
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills; demonstrated understanding of airline commercial metrics, economics, network design and revenue management principles
Exemplary written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to independently prioritize analyses in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to structure logical analytical approaches and to apply a range of quantitative techniques to solve business problems in an efficient, timely manner
Comfortable working self-sufficiently to creatively solve analytical challenges with limited data and imminent deadlines
Strong work ethic; delivers results in ambiguous, time-pressured situations
Sound judgment and ability to maintain composure under pressure
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature and level of work required of the referenced position; they are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of individuals in this position. Please be advised that duties and expectations of this position may be subject to change.

Frontier Airlines is a Zero Tolerance Drug-Free Workplace. All prospective employees are subject to pre-employment testing for the following drugs and their metabolites: Marijuana, Cocaine, Amphetamines, Opioids and Phencyclidine (PCP). Further, any applicant who is found to have tested positive on any required drug or alcohol test at a former employer will be considered ineligible for employment with Frontier.

job_title: Artificial Intelligence, Senior Manager - Applied Artificial Intelligence (Full Stack Developer)
job_description:
Artificial Intelligence, Senior Manager - Applied Artificial Intelligence (Full Stack Developer)



While analytics isn't new, we're experiencing a renaissance in the science, technology, and application of business analytics today, which makes it hard to keep up. Many business leaders are now facing the dilemma of how best to quickly get up to speed on what analytics can actually deliver in practice. That's where Deloitte’s Applied AI team can help.



Work you’ll do


We are looking to add a Developer to our team. As a Developer, you will specialize in building powerful yet elegant products using cutting edge technologies. The Developer will have the opportunity to design and build innovative applications that offer measurable business value to our clients. The individual in this role may work in either a pure development role, helping architect and design a solution, or act as a lead, managing a development team.


Evaluate client business challenges and work with the team to arrive at the best-fit technology solution components

Design, document, and develop world class web applications leveraging the full spectrum of front-end and back-end technologies and cutting-edge design patterns

Collaborate with clients and business analysts to translate business requirements into technical requirements


 • Mentor and assist with training junior developers



The team


Analytics & Cognitive


In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.



As the premier data-powered and platform-enabled cognitive consultancy, we help clients achieve competitive advantage through data and cognitive powered transformations that promote enterprise intelligence, autonomous processes, and precision stakeholder engagement



The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets



Minimum Qualifications


A Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of relevant work experience are required

Experience with the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC)

Experience with developing web applications with SOA, RESTful, and/or MVC architectures


Experience with scripting languages (JavaScript (Node.js) / Python)


Understanding of the technology landscape including open source, commercial on-premises, and cloud-based tools: Microsoft Cognitive Services, IBM Watson, IPSoft, Pega, Salesforce Einstein, Google Cloud Platform/Tensor Flow, Amazon Web Services/Sagemaker, PowerBI, SparkCognition, Expert System, Numenta, Deepmind, CognitiveScale, CustomerMatrix
Experience in Hadoop, Spark, Storm or related paradigms and associated languages such as Java/C++, R, Python, etc.
Experienced programming knowledge in both SAS and SQL, Operating system experience with UNIX and relational database knowledge such as ORACLE/TERADATA. SAS/Base, SAS/Stat, SAS/Macro preferred
Significant development experience with a lower level language (Java or C#)
Expert HTML, JavaScript, and CSS skills

 Strong database development skills



Preferred qualifications:


Full-Stack web application development experience

User Interface (UI) design knowledge

Deep experience designing modular, object-oriented programming

Strong experience with server-side Web frameworks (Django (Python), Express (Node.js), Play (Java))

Strong experience with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, PostgresDB, MySQL)

Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Neo4j)

Experience developing across Windows/UNIX

Experience developing for mobile platforms

Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development lifecycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing and operations.

Experience mentoring and/or training junior developers



How you’ll grow


At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.



Benefits


At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.



Deloitte’s culture


Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.



Corporate citizenship


Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.



Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. . Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

This position is responsible for developing complex algorithms and using advanced modeling techniques (e.g., predictive and prescriptive) to interpret data, extract insights, and help produce data science solutions to enable better decision-making. The role works with large data sets and leverages cutting edge machine learning techniques (e.g., neural networks, time-series forecasting, ensemble learning, and unsupervised learning) to train historical data to predict the validated course of action for pre-specified outcomes. The role requires integration of multiple data sets for feature creation, reduction, and selection to identify the most important unbiased drivers for the prediction. This role partners with the business to understand the business strategy and apply knowledge of statistical, mathematical, and advanced modeling techniques to ask the right questions to derive appropriate outcomes.


This associate collaborates with a cross functional team to develop, deploy, verify product quality, and maintain the predictive model lifecycle to help provide business value for the organization.


Work with business to proactively identify opportunities for advanced analytics utilization
Identify business questions or hypotheses to be analyzed
Identify best statistical or modeling method to utilize
Review prediction and optimization factors
Collaborate with business and IT partners to support the big data and cloud computing strategy
Test and troubleshoot internal advanced analytics tools
Work closely with external vendors on support and maintenance of statistical and data modeling tools
Test and review custom datasets
Support production releases of big data and statistical tools
Review, test and document changes to processes, tools and architecture
Collaborate with analysts and data scientists to use expanded data sets and query techniques
Identify test groups and data sources
Identify control group to minimize bias
Independently conduct ad-hoc data mining activities
Present findings of small to medium-scale advanced analytics analyses to non-technical stakeholders
Work with business to identify and recommend additional test factors and re-test as needed
Participate in continuing education to enhance the level of advanced analytics knowledge and skills
Participate in research, consortiums, seminars, and events to obtain advanced analytics expertise


4 Year College Degree or Equivalent Experience
Graduate Degree Preferred in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business
3-5 related experience required
Experience with data science techniques such as profiling, a/b testing, ensemble learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, feature reduction, time-series forecasting, Bayesian Statistics, etc.
Experience in data profiling, data mining, data cleaning, feature engineering and predictive analytics
Understanding of enterprise data warehouses and related data platforms
Hands-on experience with data tools and programming languages including SQL & Python
Must be proficient in developing and tuning Python & Postgres SQL
Experience with data visualization
Hands-on experience with big data & cloud computing
Experience of data models to support advanced/predictive analytics
Must be business-centric, data-oriented, analytically minded and results driven
Demonstrated critical thinking skills to scope and frame problems
Displays excellent judgment to propose effective, business driven solutions
Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills to effectively educate and coach teammates and business partners
Military education or experience may be considered in lieu of civilian requirements listed
CDMP (Certified Data Management Professional) preferred
CBIP (Certified Business Intelligence Professional) preferred
CAP (Certified Analytics Professional) preferred
DGSP (Data Governance and Stewardship Professional) preferred
Military education or experience may be considered in lieu of civilian requirements listed

Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.
 We are looking for a Data Scientist Manager for Pilgrim’s that is based out of the Greeley, CO Corporate Office.



 Responsibilities:


Leverage the optimum machine learning techniques for predictions in various Business Units such as Procurement, Sales, Marketing, Operations, etc. to enhance revenue and reduce costs.
Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning production pipelines (data exploration, data preprocessing, feature engineering, model building, and performance evaluation).
Maintain existing and setup new machine learning hardware/software infrastructure with latest updates.
Collect and maintain data in local and cloud computing platform such as SAP BI Hana, SQL Server, AWS etc.
Setup and maintain code check-in/check-out system such as git-hub for each project.
Present and defend findings predictions results and methods to peers and executives through effective data visualizations techniques.
Work with different business units across the company to understand their needs and help identify new predictions opportunities.
Proficiently use SQL for data extractions.
Development of comprehensive solutions in QlikSense using QVD, CSV files with data coming from SAP BI.
Fine tuning of data models and QVD data to minimize latency.
Thorough understanding of star schema, facts, dimensions, infocubes, data marts for understanding and designing of data models as needed.
Creating Calculated Kay Figures, input parameters, filters and other reporting components with minimal hard-coding and customizations for scalability.
Providing expert statistical guidance on suggesting appropriate statistical charts, graphs, diagrams etc. to design “single-glance” dashboards at executive level to comprehend full story.
Recognize and understand business drivers required to be represented/accented within the QlikSense reports.
Create decision making Economic/Marketing Calculators Tools utilizing carious Statistical functions in Excel, QlikSense for various Analysts.
Design reports using minimalist design (UI) style to navigate detailed/aggregated reports and cross functional reports with minimal mouse clicks.
Design each report with data and report dissemination and download ability respectively.
Dashboard designing and visualizations must come naturally for optimum UI/UX experience. This holds the highest importance.
Gather requirements and convert requirements into use cases for development.

End to end process operations entail teams collaborations and resources management.
Integrate cross functional related Data Sources into Single Source databases to enable cross functional advanced analyses.
Evaluate data providers and evaluated data itself and the data analytical tools & Technology like for eg SAS.

Highly proficient in Python, and SQL.
Solid technical and-on skills in machine learning (regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction), deep learning (CNN, RNN/LSTM, GAN), time series data, anomaly detection, statistical algorithms, data mining, and data engineering.
Proficient in Keras, TensorFlow, optimizers and other machine learning techniques.

Strong ability to use logic and excellent problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated experience with agile or other rapid development methods.
Experience in agricultural/meat/animal husbandry industries is a plus.
Two to three years of experience with a Qliksense driven workshop. Ability to analyze data from multiple sources and aggregate into a cohesive output.
MS Office proficiency, SAP BI HANA knowledge, QlikSense reporting proficiency.
EOE/M/F/V/Disabled

Design experiments and formulate machine learning problems to address major business challenges and innovation opportunities
Work with product managers and data engineers to discover, collect, cleanse, and refine the data needed for analysis and modeling
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and inform experimental design and model development
Write lucid, compelling summaries to communicate results of your analysis, model development, and testing which inform how the business should act
Collaborate with peers, challenging assumptions and providing constructive criticism and ideas for improvement

Harden models for production deployment and monitor model performance over time

Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, machine learning, data science, mathematics, statistics, or related quantitative field

Excellent knowledge of major machine learning algorithms

Communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication skills and the ability to use data to tell a story
Willing to learn and keep pace with the latest advances in data science and machine learning
Attention to detail and results oriented, with a strong customer focus

Our Culture
At Transamerica we promote a Future Fit mindset. What is a Future Fit mindset?
Acting as One fosters an environment of positive collaboration
Accountability allows us to own the problem as well as the solution
Agility inspires new ideas, innovation and challenges the status quo
Customer Centricity encourages an above and beyond approach to our customer
Working Conditions
Office environment

About our company

-----------------



Unsupervised is a Boulder-based startup, building products that make it easy for people working with large amounts of data to discover the most important insights. This helps our customers, large consumer companies, better serve their customers: hundreds of millions of people across the world.



Our product is only possible because of the advances that we've pioneered in AI. We are one of the only companies in the world building artificial intelligence systems based on unsupervised learning. This gives us an incredible technical advantage and has produced incredible demand for our product.



About the role

--------------



This is a unique opportunity to work with a team of experts, working with sophisticated forms of AI, and to play an integral role in building a company.



What you'll do

--------------------




Apply machine learning techniques to real-world data: from data pipelining to cleaning to final results.
Work cross-functionally with Customer Success Managers to solve our customer's business problems with data. Understanding and interpreting the kinds of insights that are useful and actionable to business users.
Engineer new features to enrich already complex data.
Build tools to automate enrichment for future projects. As the primary user of our internal tools, you'll be uniquely positioned to grow our functionality.
Develop intuition about different types of data and projects. Guide the success team towards solutions.

About you

---------




Curious: You want to learn about different industries, business domains, and data science techniques. You're not satisfied until you have the right answer, and you know that the right answer is not a fixed target.
Results-oriented: You're a natural born executor who loves making to-do lists and getting projects done. When you hit a problem, you have 15 ideas for ways to fix it.
Hungry: You want to learn about lots of different industries. You're ambitious and excited to be surrounded by, and learn from, PhD Data Scientists and technology leaders.
Fast and action-oriented: We're a startup, so agility is our bread and butter. We want you to be excited, not frustrated, by the process of building, shipping, and iterating on things.
Customer-oriented: You have experience answering business questions and working with customer data towards a specific goal — you know to look out for standard data mistakes. You have a desire to find an impact for a customer, understanding their context, with the ability to interpret and empathize with customer needs. You want to interact directly with customers and have excellent communication skills to do so.

Candidates must have




2-5 years of professional experience as an analyst or data scientist
Serving results with Python, Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, and Linux
Comfort writing end-to-end data science pipelines, taking raw data to models serving predictions
Experience working with customers, setting expectations, and meeting commitments

Candidates with the following will stand out




Academic background related to Data Science (degrees in Computer Science, Mathematics, or similar)
Experience with real-world application of data science techniques
Experience working with enterprise data
Algebraic Topology experience
Understanding of principal component analysis
Academic background related to Data Science (degrees in Computer Science, Mathematics, or similar)

Compensation range

------------------



$80k – $120k+ equity



Perks & benefits

--------------------




Great health vision, and dental care
Competitive compensation
401K match
Unlimited vacation

Company Culture

---------------



Our mission is serious, but our culture is fun, authentic, and designed to take care of the wonderful people who spend time here. We think deeply about how we work and constantly try to build a workplace and culture that will improve your daily work.

Deloitte Services LP includes internal support areas such as Sales Excellence, Marketing and Communications, Human Resources/Talent, Information Technology, Facilities Management, and Financial Support Services.


Data Scientist


The Data Scientist provides direct support to GPS Sales Excellence by providing sales and pipeline analytics of Deloitte’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system (Salesforce), business development artifacts, and client documents.


The GPS Data Scientist is responsible for collaborating with Leadership and other Enabling Areas to understand their processes and data and therefore determine the most efficient and cost-effective manner to provide insights and subsequently predictive analyses on our bidding strategies, pipeline, and future sales.


This individual will apply natural language processing/machine learning to facilitate research, gather, and design processes and/or use technology to mine various business development artifacts, such as proposals, client documents, competitive research, and other corporate data repositories to identify ways to improve our win rate. The data scientist will also need to integrate data from disparate sources into an efficient and intuitive rational database structure.


Work you’ll do


As a Data Scientist within our team you will:
Assist Sales Excellence leaders with Mercury sales and pipeline data analyses
Coordinate with other internal organizations to understand business development processes and data
Provide recommendations and predictive analysis to senior leaders on improving bid strategies and subsequently win rates.

location: Global Resource Solutions32 reviews-Colorado Springs, CO
job_description:
Global Resource Solutions, Inc. (GRS) is seeking an enthusiastic, motivated and talented individual for the position Cyber Security Data Scientist.


Job Description:


Summary: Global Resource Solutions has an immediate opening for an Cyber Security Data Analyst. This position provides an opportunity to further advance the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation’s core defense/intelligence services and systems. Global Resource Solutions employees work closely with esteemed customers to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:


Responsible for leading and managing the day-to-day operations of the storage area network (SAN) team. Oversees all aspects of the SAN architecture, providing insight on the design, backup strategies, and networking. Manages project and workloads of SAN team, overseeing system analysis activities, troubleshooting, and incident management. Develops per customer requirements and designs solutions related to Big Data, Data Governance, and large scale date search and storage. Frontier Airlines is committed to offering ‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 80 destinations in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 300 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Rocky Mountain hospitality to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2016 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies.
The Senior Analyst, Revenue Analytics develops analytical tools and statistical models to maximize Frontier’s revenue generation and profitability. The Analyst will be responsible for building data pipelines & coding automated reporting processes, creating data visualizations and dashboards, identifying and quantifying revenue opportunities, and crafting clear presentations to management. As an integral part of Frontier's success, Revenue Analytics Analysts receive high visibility by senior management and enjoy a range of formal training and informal learning opportunities to support ongoing professional development and career growth.
Essential Functions:
Identify & quantify revenue opportunities across the organization
Work with the Pricing and Revenue Management teams to identify new opportunities for generating revenue
Build statistical models and present findings to relevant stakeholders
Create visualizations and dashboards to illustrate key trends and KPIs
Work with a wide variety of teams with diverse technical backgrounds
Enhance the Revenue Analytics infrastructure by implementing best practice coding & structure
Create data pipelines to transform raw input into clean datasets for use in analysis
Write clean, efficient code to automate processes
Mentor more junior team members, and foster the development of their programming and analytics skills
Collaborate with diverse teams across the company
Conduct ad-hoc projects, reports and analyses as determined by management
Set the standard for the broader team in thought processes and analytical output
Achieve expert status in business and industry trends
Clearly communicate the actionable business implications of complex quantitative analyses to senior management
Lead change across the organization by improving directly owned processes and taking initiative to champion cross-functional opportunities
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree required; major(s) in Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Aviation Management or related analytical field strongly preferred; combination of education and work experience considered in lieu of degree
Advanced degree in one of above disciplines preferred
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, revenue management, operations research, finance, or a similar analytical field (Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline will be considered with reduced years of experience)
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong programming skills, with knowledge of Python strongly preferred
Ability to write complex SQL code to query against disparate data sources
Strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with Power BI or Tableau
Solid grasp of statistics or machine learning preferred
Strong organizational skills and the ability to keep track of several projects at once
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills; demonstrated understanding of airline commercial metrics, economics, network design and revenue management principles
Exemplary written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to independently prioritize analyses in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to structure logical analytical approaches and to apply a range of quantitative techniques to solve business problems in an efficient, timely manner
Comfortable working self-sufficiently to creatively solve analytical challenges with limited data and imminent deadlines
Strong work ethic; delivers results in ambiguous, time-pressured situations
Sound judgment and ability to maintain composure under pressure

Job Description:

The Data Architect is a key member of the MDA DE/S Enterprise Engineering team and is responsible for assisting in the design of the requirements, design, architecture, implementation, and governance of data architectures, data management systems, and data analysis systems supporting system level Modeling and Simulation systems. This position will work across a broad range of issues and policy areas by developing and employing technologies such as data pipelines, data services, operational data stores, data warehouses, data marts, big data stores leading to statistical inference, data mining visualization, experiment design, and advanced insights. The right individual will display both a passion for answering difficult or ambiguous questions with data science and leading a cultural change in how data is used throughout the organization these efforts support.



Support creation of an end-to-end vision for how simulation data and its resulting information is used and flows through the MDA



Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging simulation data to drive MDA, BMDS, M&S solutions



Recommends solutions particularly cloud technology, data management, and data analysis solutions



Follows best-practices for architecture principles, standards, guidelines and concepts



In collaboration with the users, creates and maintains data governance process



Design data solutions using API’s and integrating data access layers across systems



Advocate, design, develop, and deliver analytic solutions that challenge assumptions and expand thinking of what is possible



Implements cloud-based data solutions using new or emerging technologies (COTS and Open Source)



Implements data solutions using API’s and integrating data access layers across systems



Drives the data architecture, development and application of capabilities



Partners with technology teams to implement appropriate technical approaches for integration (Open Source, COTS, and GOTS)



Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets



Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy



Job Requirements:

Experience:

A minimum of 10 years of industry experience with IT and information management



A minimum 5 years as a data architect



A minimum of 3 years of hands on experience in applying data science techniques to real business intelligence problems



Education



B.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent required



Advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Statics, or related discipline strongly preferred.



Knowledge



Understanding of missile defense and the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS)



Strong understanding of modeling and simulation



Familiarity with MBSE and SysML



Knowledge of available cloud-based data architecture solutions



Knowledge of data modeling techniques and tools



Familiarity with Project and Systems Development Life Cycle Methodologies



Familiarity with standard IT practices related to application development and implementation



Understanding of how to apply statistical and predictive modeling, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and other algorithms within a business context



Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural Networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks is preferred



Skills



Foundation in systems development life cycle, software project management approaches, and requirements, design, and test techniques



Ability to conceptualize and influence application and interface projects by understanding what advice to give and where to plug in to steer toward desirable outcomes



Core skill depth in data modeling and database design effective and sound across all phases of data modeling, from conceptualization to optimization



Experience in established and emerging data technologies, established data management and reporting technologies, like columnar, Hadoop, and NoSQL databases, predictive analytics, data visualization, and unstructured data



Ability to conceive and portray the big data picture by mapping the systems and interfaces used to manage data, sets standards for data management, analyzes current state, conceives desired future state, plans projects needed to close the gap between current and future state



Ability to astutely operate within the organization to emphasize methodology, modeling, and governance, technologically and politically neutral, articulate, persuasive, and enthusiastic



Experience with data and visualization tools like Micro strategy, Tableau, Infomatica is preferred



Proficiency in Python, R, Matlab, C++, SQL is preferred



Strong written and oral communication skills, including technical & functional documentation, presentation materials and status reporting



Capable of translating business needs into technical specifications



Ability to lead effective meetings that are tailored to the audience



A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques



Must be self-motivated with a proven track record in leading architecture and delivery of enterprise data platforms

Verizon is serious about innovation. About being the first and being the best. Collaborate with data engineers to operationalize developed models and algorithms for production.
Use your passion for identifying and answering hard questions using the power of data driven decisioning to improve business performance.

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, statistics, or mathematics or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Three or more years of experience with exceptional data mining, statistical analysis, and coding experience.
Experience in analyzing and deconstructing very large data sets.
Even better if you have:
Master’s degree or PhD (in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science, operations research).
An aptitude for solving problems, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a desire to unlock the strategic value that lies within Verizon’s unique data.
Strong data mining, statistical analysis, and coding skills.
Work experience on the Amazon Web Services platform.
Knowledge of geospatial databases such as Postgres.
Ability to balance the “art and science” of solving analytical problems using quantitative and qualitative approaches.
Passion for evangelizing how data and information can be leveraged across Verizon.
Ability to turn significant amounts of data into informative and insightful actions through various statistical techniques that create explosive business results.
Ability to work independently as well as lead small cross-functional teams.
Thought leadership in location based analytics.
Experience with mobile technologies, geospatial and location services.
Experience with Deep Learning technologies such as Convolutional Neural Networks and their application to computer vision.
Familiarity with agile development methodology.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. We are the ML Applications, Services, and Platform team in Workday. Our focus is on the practical application of search, machine learning, statistical analysis and distributed computing. Workday is the Cloud-based SaaS company providing industry-leading solutions in the space of HR, Financials, Workforce planning and Learning for more than 40% of the Fortune 500. We leverage incredibly diverse data to build data-driven products with ML at its core to help the world’s largest organizations uncover useful insights and make strategic decisions about their people, finances, and business.
As a Manager in Machine Learning Financials Product Organization, you will help your team tackle user pain points leveraging variety of Machine Learning techniques like Anomaly Detection, Natural Language Processing/Understanding, Deep Learning among others. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a growth team that is focused on building predictive capabilities across the Financials Product area to continue pushing Workday up and to the right in the Gartner Leader Quadrant. You will utilize Workday’s vast computing resources on rich and extensive and exclusive datasets to deliver value to transform the way Finance departments work. We will help push you to bring your best creative thinking, problem-solving, innovation and people leadership abilities to make an impact on thousands of enterprise customers and millions of people. This is your chance to make an indelible impact on the global economy by helping all enterprises realize their potential through intelligent, predictive Finance Products.
Excited? In this role, you shall:
Manage a team of ML Engineers/Data Scientists and Software Engineers (3 and growing)
Enable, empower, mentor the team, and provide career development support
Develop and evangelize best practices (i.e. Agile) in development to share and help other teams within Workday
Be the Mentor responsible for driving team execution for the ML Product
Own continuous support, performance and enhancement of ML products developed by the team
Work with ML platform team to design and implement end-to-end solutions for Workday customers
We would love to discuss your:
Proven track record of guiding successful execution on backend, data pipelines or platform products
Proficiency in at least one high level programming languages like Java, Scala, C++ or Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas)
Earnestly mentoring team members build engineering skills via code reviews, creating projects that will help them build engineering, automation skills
Ability to steer a team of highly skilled engineers, to set priorities and solve problems
Experience driving end to end execution for a xfunctional team in all phases of software development life cycles
Resilience in the face of obstacles, ability to foresee and unblock team and clear the road to help them stay focused on execution.
You have a solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals (based on a BS, MS in CS or equivalent field)

Ibotta is seeking an Associate Decision Scientist to help us build the next Ibotta, with exceptional technology. This includes the building the next iterations of the app, mobile and online payments, new features driven by algorithms, and expert analysis to help the Product teams make data-driven decisions to build a more engaging app experience.



As an Associate Decision Scientist, you will be responsible for using the latest developments in statistics, machine learning, and A/B testing methodologies to understand the business in-depth, support strategic options, build state-of-the-art tools, and improve our future product developments.



Here is what you'll be doing:


Working cross-functionally with the Product team to analyze usage and uncovering key, actionable insights about Ibotta users behavior
Running statistical analysis and create predictive models based on past user purchases and behavior
Designing and measuring controlled experiments to determine the potential impact of new approaches
Understanding and reporting business performance in detail and identifying opportunities for improving the app experience.

Here is what we're looking for (required):


1+ years of relevant work experience
An understanding of the key concepts of consumer behavior
Strong SQL knowledge, data wrangling, and analytical skills
Ability to think creatively and provide thoughtful insights
Ability to develop, automate, visualize, analyze, and communicate learnings
Ability to work collaboratively throughout an organization to drive towards common goals
Bachelor's degree in analytics/mathematics/statistics/data science/computer science/economics or equivalent experience

Here is what we're looking for (preferred):


Experience using modern data analysis tools (such as R, Python, or Spark)
Knowledge of A/B testing concepts
Practical work experience in analytics in a consumer-facing industry

JOB DESCRIPTION
Engineering



Company Overview



Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard. Frontdoor serves more than two million customers across the U.S. through a network of 15,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ over 45,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unplanned breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With more than 45 years of experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually (or one request every eight seconds). For more details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

This is the role you are looking for, if:

you interested in working at the intersection of applied quantitative research, engineering development, and data science
you have an interest in building a high-performance data science group that delightful consumer experience through solving quantitative problems



Responsibilities



Solve the supply-demand problems of service professional and home repair
model home appliances and their maintenance schedule based on 50 years of industry data
build models that take aspects of weather-related trends to predict demands of services
Create models of service assignments based on experiences by customer's interaction with service professionals
build the Data Science function at Frontdoor
Define data science strategy for Frontdoor
Lead and mentor a team of Data Scientists and Analysts
Hands-on leader, you will personally own critical initiatives.
Find new opportunities to put our data to work in service of our customers without compromising end-user privacy or security.
Partner with the Engineering organization to define the data infrastructure


Required qualifications



Excellent educational background in a quantitative field, such as Operations Research, Economics/Econometrics, or Machine Learning
Comfortable with research methodologies to address abstract business and product problems with utmost precision, while staying grounded in common sense. Makes complex problems simple
5-7 years industry experience in data analytics and quantitative modeling, with significant work experience as a technical contributor
3-5 years of startup experience
5-7 years of team leadership experience
Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent written skills and interpersonal
Enjoys being a leader
Experience with common analysis tools - SQL, Python, R, etc.
Demonstrable familiarity with code and programming concepts (modeling exercise during the interview)
Self-starter and relentless personal drive to get things done
Ability to drive multiple initiatives at once, while constantly driving focus on the highest priorities


Preferred Qualifications



Ph.D. degree
Experience with operations, routing, dispatch, logistics modelization
Experience with deep learning, representation learning, convex & combinatorial optimization, hypothesis testing, causal inference, and behavioral modeling
Experience leading a distributed team, deeply embedded in multiple functions and businesses

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon is serious about innovation. About being the first and being the best. Verizon Location Services (VLS) sits at the core of the Strategy and New Business Development organization and is a critical part of driving innovation across our global customer base, both inside and outside of Verizon. Backed by more than 50 years of location-based expertise, we are building solutions that leverage the power of location intelligence to help drive technologies of the future. Technologies like 5G, Multi-Access Edge Computing and Artificial Intelligence that are allowing us to create products that were previously impossible. We’re building tomorrow with the best of today.
Use your experience and skill set (along with your imagination) to manipulate and analyze complex, high volume, high dimensionality data from varying sources to help develop various types of data-driven insights and products.
Spearhead statistical analysis, 3rd party data integration and hypothesis testing.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes supporting model development, model validation, and model implementation against large scale datasets.
Collaborate with data engineers to operationalize developed models and algorithms for production.
Use your passion for identifying and answering hard questions using the power of data driven decisioning to improve business performance.
What we’re looking for...
You will need to have:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, statistics, or mathematics or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Three or more years of experience with exceptional data mining, statistical analysis, and coding experience.
Experience in analyzing and deconstructing very large data sets.
Even better if you have:
Master’s degree or PhD (in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science, operations research).
An aptitude for solving problems, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a desire to unlock the strategic value that lies within Verizon’s unique data.
Strong data mining, statistical analysis, and coding skills.
Work experience on the Amazon Web Services platform.
Knowledge of geospatial databases such as Postgres.
Ability to balance the “art and science” of solving analytical problems using quantitative and qualitative approaches.
Passion for evangelizing how data and information can be leveraged across Verizon.
Ability to turn significant amounts of data into informative and insightful actions through various statistical techniques that create explosive business results.
Ability to work independently as well as lead small cross-functional teams.
Thought leadership in location based analytics.
Experience with mobile technologies, geospatial and location services.
Experience with Deep Learning technologies such as Convolutional Neural Networks and their application to computer vision.
Familiarity with agile development methodology.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Associate Predictive Modeler



Argo Group, through its operating subsidiaries, offers high-quality Property and Casualty (P&C) insurance and reinsurance products and services. At Argo Group, we leverage the success, discipline and expertise of our people and an understanding of our customers’ needs to provide a diverse portfolio of products and services. This approach helps those we insure drive down their ultimate cost through prevention and aggressive claims handling. Simply stated, our products and services help keep businesses in business.




Argo Group has an exciting and challenging opportunity for an Associate Predictive Modeler preferably in our Denver, CO office but can also be located in New York, NY, Chicago, IL, or Scottsdale, AZ.
Job Description
Duties & responsibilities:
Working as part of the actuarial team in conjunction with our wider business colleagues
Developing loss cost, profitability, risk triaging and risk segmentation models and tools
Working with our colleagues to design and deploy models to end users
Take an active role in teaching and upskilling the wider actuarial team in technical matters
Support projects throughout their cycle: data work, reconciliation, problem articulation, modeling, communication, delivery, monitoring
Support research and development of bespoke modeling solutions spanning traditional statistical, actuarial, and data science fields
Qualifications and skills:
Bachelor's Degree, Masters or PhD in related field of study: Math, Stats, Computer Science, other Applied Science
Actuarial exams a plus
1-3 years of experience in a technical capacity, specific knowledge of insurance a plus
Detailed understanding of and the ability to apply traditional statistical methods and more modern techniques to big, small and messy data
Models and methods: GLM, GBM, MCMC, bagging, boosting, trees, neural nets, regularization, Bayesian inference, regression/classification, unsupervised learning, time series, bootstrapping, cross validation
Advanced data preparation and visualization skills
Advanced and flexible programming skills in R/Python or similar
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to management and other functional areas.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, national origin or citizenship (including language use restrictions), denial of family and medical care leave, disability (mental and physical) , including HIV and AIDS, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), race, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, child birth, breastfeeding, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, child birth or breastfeeding), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or other status protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
Applicants: For the most convenient application experience, please use the “Apply with LinkedIn” button. If manually entering, only include your most recent or relevant job information needed for this role. For either method, please attach your most current resume. Additional job history may be obtained if selected for the interview process.

Frontier Airlines is committed to offering ‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 80 destinations in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 300 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Rocky Mountain hospitality to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2016 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies.
The Senior Analyst, Revenue Analytics develops analytical tools and statistical models to maximize Frontier’s revenue generation and profitability. The Analyst will be responsible for building data pipelines & coding automated reporting processes, creating data visualizations and dashboards, identifying and quantifying revenue opportunities, and crafting clear presentations to management. As an integral part of Frontier's success, Revenue Analytics Analysts receive high visibility by senior management and enjoy a range of formal training and informal learning opportunities to support ongoing professional development and career growth.
Essential Functions:
Identify & quantify revenue opportunities across the organization
Work with the Pricing and Revenue Management teams to identify new opportunities for generating revenue
Build statistical models and present findings to relevant stakeholders
Create visualizations and dashboards to illustrate key trends and KPIs
Work with a wide variety of teams with diverse technical backgrounds
Enhance the Revenue Analytics infrastructure by implementing best practice coding & structure
Create data pipelines to transform raw input into clean datasets for use in analysis
Write clean, efficient code to automate processes
Mentor more junior team members, and foster the development of their programming and analytics skills
Collaborate with diverse teams across the company
Conduct ad-hoc projects, reports and analyses as determined by management
Set the standard for the broader team in thought processes and analytical output
Achieve expert status in business and industry trends
Clearly communicate the actionable business implications of complex quantitative analyses to senior management
Lead change across the organization by improving directly owned processes and taking initiative to champion cross-functional opportunities
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree required; major(s) in Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Aviation Management or related analytical field strongly preferred; combination of education and work experience considered in lieu of degree
Advanced degree in one of above disciplines preferred
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, revenue management, operations research, finance, or a similar analytical field (Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline will be considered with reduced years of experience)
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong programming skills, with knowledge of Python strongly preferred
Ability to write complex SQL code to query against disparate data sources
Strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with Power BI or Tableau
Solid grasp of statistics or machine learning preferred
Strong organizational skills and the ability to keep track of several projects at once
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills; demonstrated understanding of airline commercial metrics, economics, network design and revenue management principles
Exemplary written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to independently prioritize analyses in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to structure logical analytical approaches and to apply a range of quantitative techniques to solve business problems in an efficient, timely manner
Comfortable working self-sufficiently to creatively solve analytical challenges with limited data and imminent deadlines
Strong work ethic; delivers results in ambiguous, time-pressured situations
Sound judgment and ability to maintain composure under pressure
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature and level of work required of the referenced position; they are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of individuals in this position. Please be advised that duties and expectations of this position may be subject to change.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including: recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Frontier Airlines is a Zero Tolerance Drug-Free Workplace. All prospective employees are subject to pre-employment testing for the following drugs and their metabolites: Marijuana, Cocaine, Amphetamines, Opioids and Phencyclidine (PCP). Further, any applicant who is found to have tested positive on any required drug or alcohol test at a former employer will be considered ineligible for employment with Frontier.

location: JBS USA Food Company3,149 reviews-Greeley, CO 80639
job_description:
Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.
 We are looking for a Data Scientist for Pilgrim’s that is based out of the Greeley, CO Corporate Office.
 Responsibilities:
Development of comprehensive solutions in QlikSense using QVD, CSV files with data coming from SAP BI.
Fine tuning of data models and QVD data to minimize latency.
Thorough understanding of star schema, facts, dimensions, infocubes, data marts for understanding and designing of data models as needed.
Creating Calculated Key Figures, input parameters, filters and other reporting components with minimal hard-coding and customization for scalability.
Providing expert statistical guidance on suggesting appropriate statistical charts, graphs, diagrams etc. to design “single-glance” dashboards at executive level to comprehend full story.
Recognize and understand business drivers required to be represented/accented within the QlikSense reports.
Design reports using minimalist design (UI) style to navigate detailed aggregated reports and cross functional reports with minimal mouse clicks.
Design each report with data and report dissemination and download ability respectively.
Dashboard designing and visualizations must come naturally for optimum UI/UX experience.
Gather requirements and convert requirements into use cases for development.
Ensure reports to be easily scalable and modifiable for future modifications.
Leverage the optimum machine learning techniques for predictions to enhance revenue and reduce costs.
Design, develop, and implement end to end machine learning production pipelines (data exploration, data preprocessing, feature engineering, model building, and performance evaluation).
Maintain existing and setup new machine learning hardware/software infrastructure with latest updates.
Collect and maintain data in local and cloud computing platform such as SAP BI Hana, SQL Server, AWS etc.
Setup and maintain code check-in/check-out system such as git-hub for each project.
Present findings and defend predictions results and methods to peers and executives through effective data visualization techniques.
Work with different business units across the company to understand their needs and help identify new predictions opportunities.
 Qualifications:
Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Business Analytics or related fields.
Must have two to three years of experience with a Qliksense driven workshop.
Three or more years of Data Science experience.
Verifiable Data Science immersion program from a reputable academy can augment academic qualifications and professional experience.
Experience working with SQL Server, Qlikview (QVD), cloud computing databases.
Understanding of various data modeling concepts such as relational database, star schema.
Highly proficient in Python, and SQL.
Technical skills in machine learning (Regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction), deep learning (CNN, RNN/LSTM, GAN), time series data, anomaly detection, statistical algorithms, data mining, and data engineering.
Proficient in Karas, TensorFlow, optimizers and other machine learning techniques.
Experienced in cloud computing to run models and connect to various systems using connecting tools such as putty.
Strong ability to use logic and excellent problem-solving skills.
Experience in agricultural/meat/animal husbandry industries is a plus.
Ability to analyze data from multiple sources and aggregate into a cohesive output.
MS Office proficiency, SAP BI proficiency, reporting sense strongly preferred.
 EOE/M/F/V/Disabled #JBS1

Develops and programs methods, automated processes, and systems to cleanse, integrate and analyze structured and unstructured, diverse big data sources to generate actionable insights and solutions using machine learning and advanced analytics. Interprets and communicates insights and findings from analyses and experiments to other analysts, data scientists, team members and business partners. This position is responsible for various analysis work that directly influences management and executive decision making, system optimization, predictive and prescriptive analytics, and various analytics that guide continuous improvement to the Consumer Finance team and it's decision making process. The Senior Data Scientist will be highly visible to executive levels and will take part in shaping the future of Consumer Finance at Centurylink.
Job Description
Ability to execute data discovery, exploratory data analysis, and iteratively develop predictive and prescriptive models to identify optimal solutions. Assist with operationalizing the solutions and changing business processes to maximize the value of those solutions.Analyze data and build predictive and prescriptive models in a wide range of areas including customer segmentation and lifetime, business performance, customer clustering, capacity planning, asset profitablity, cost management, and various other areas.Mine information for previously unknown patterns and insights hidden in these assets and leverage them for competitive advantage.The problems solved will be at the cutting edge of technology and will lie at the intersection of science, engineering, and business acumen.Be part of a highly skilled agile team and within the Consumer Finance team.
Specific Skill Required (Must have skills)
Experience with SQL, database navigation in an Oracle data environment and Data Lake unstructured environments.Python and/or R data script writing.Very strong in math and statistics at the post graduate level.Masters in a mathematical and modeling discipline a must, PHD preferred.Experienced in writing formulas, expressions and algorithms as needed to support analytical work.Understands how to explore unstructured data to gain insights and build models to produce results.Strong communication skills and relationship skills.
Qualifications
Ability to perform ad-hoc statistical analysis including correlation analysis, frequency distribution analysis, probabilistic modeling, sophisticated forecasting, and academic based predictive and prescriptive methods.Capable of modeling the relationships between many sources of raw data, develop models that can serve to provide insight to support decision making and guide financial decisions.Ability to write customized algorithms to drive predictive and prescriptive analysis in business management, creating actionable recommendations to improve Financial Decisions.Can be flexible to work on various types of projects, often balancing multiple deliverables with a wide range of complexity requirements.Is comfortable working with teams, sharing code among peers, and presenting to leadership.Has a genuine drive to succeed and self-motivated to take care of business , while positively representing the team.

Altamira Technologies has a long and successful history providing innovative solutions throughout the U.S. National Security community. Headquartered in McLean, Virginia, Altamira serves the defense, intelligence and homeland security communities worldwide by focusing on creating innovative solutions leveraging common standards in architecture, data and security. Altamira believes that our people and the culture of our company differentiate us from other companies.



The responsibilities of the AI / ML Specialist include, but are not limited to, aligning the J2 workforce with the growing use of IC and DoD AI / ML initiatives / projects. Supports the research, acquisition, fielding, sustaining and training of AI / ML tools / applications into the J2 workforce.



Work Requirements:

The AI/ML Specialist will
Create AI / ML models to run systematic processes on raw data and selecting models that pull the most relevant information from collected data to assist creating IC and DoD machine learning programs to look for or seek out specific conditions in space / space related data and respond based on USSPACECOM PIRs / CCIRs.
Support USSTRATCOM intelligence processes critical to near-term, mid-term, and far-term efforts for the Command, components, and other DoD organizations.

Master’s degree in a Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related quantitative field.
20 years experience
